lines.text: You're quite accustomed to being admired by women, aren't you? All those, uh, ridiculous, uh...
Sighs? Yes, you're quite right. They are ridiculous. I must say it's refreshing to be with a beautiful woman who's above that sort of thing.
Why I never said I was above that sort of thing. What I meant was...
Yes?
You really are good at it Mr. Flint.
[Flint laughs]
Tell me something. What is it about you that makes you so irresistible to women?
It's very simple. I don't compete with them.
[Flint takes Lisa's face and kisses her]
Now that ends the suspense.
You're quite right. I was curious. Well, now you've had the tour and so have I.
[On hearing that the president has been replaced by an impostor.]
An actor? As president?
[Flint prepares to board the plane to go to the desert]
Empty all the ashtrays?
Nah, I got you a new plane.
Ah, beautiful! Let's go.
Flint, How do you find time to read all these books?
No, no, no, sir, I wrote those.
Well, ladies. It was touch and go but I hope you learned your lesson. The world is better off in our hands.
You're absolutely right, sir.
Derek, darling. Your American music is so decadent.
Yeah.
But it's so exciting.
Well, that's where it's at, honey.
[Flint shatters a billiard ball with a hand-held sonic device]
It's extraordinary!

[Scoffs]
It's a toy. However, we *are* making such scientific strides that
[grabs book from shelf and hands it to Cramden]
this last year's book is already out of date
How *do* you find time to read?
No no, I wrote that...
